unnormalised: Hey Quorans! Let's talk about Urban Gym Culture, especially here in India.
normalised: Hey Quorans! Let's talk about Urban Gym Culture, especially here in India.

unnormalised: Have you noticed how gym culture has just exploded in the last few years? It's not just about losing weight anymore, is it? It's a whole lifestyle! You see people rocking those gym outfits even on their way to work from places like Bandra to Bangalore.
normalised: Have you noticed how gym culture has just exploded in the last few years? It's not just about losing weight anymore, is it? It's a whole lifestyle! You see people rocking those gym outfits even on their way to work from places like Bandra to Bangalore.

unnormalised: I think Instagram and Bollywood play a huge role. Seeing actors like Ranveer Singh flaunting their physiques definitely motivates a lot of people to hit the gym. Remember 'Dangal'? That whole transformation narrative really struck a chord.
normalised: I think Instagram and Bollywood play a huge role. Seeing actors like Ranveer Singh flaunting their physiques definitely motivates a lot of people to hit the gym. Remember 'Dangal'? That whole transformation narrative really struck a chord.

unnormalised: Here in Delhi, I see so many new gyms popping up every month. It's crazy! From CrossFit boxes to fancy yoga studios, there's something for everyone. My friend, Priya, who went to IIT Delhi, says even back then, the gym culture was decent, but now it's a whole different level. People are way more serious about their fitness.
normalised: Here in Delhi, I see so many new gyms popping up every month. It's crazy! From CrossFit boxes to fancy yoga studios, there's something for everyone. My friend, Priya, who went to I I T Delhi, says even back then, the gym culture was decent, but now it's a whole different level. People are way more serious about their fitness.

unnormalised: But is it all positive? Are we getting caught up in unrealistic body image expectations? Or is it a good thing that people are prioritizing their health and well-being? What are your thoughts? Also, are the protein supplements actually worth the Rs. 3000 they cost? Discuss!
normalised: But is it all positive? Are we getting caught up in unrealistic body image expectations? Or is it a good thing that people are prioritizing their health and well-being? What are your thoughts? Also, are the protein supplements actually worth the rupee three thousand they cost? Discuss!
